bibl.title: Letter from the Surgeon General to P. F. Harvey, November 14, 1906

div1.p: Harvey is asked to attend, on behalf of the Corps, the dedication of the bronze memorial tablet in honor of Walter Reed at Kings County Hospital, Brooklyn, New York. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Letter from the Surgeon General to P. F. Harvey, November 14, 1906
div1.opener:

WAR DEPARTMENT,
OFFICE OF THE SURGEON GENERAL,
WASHINGTON.
November 14, 1906
Colonel P. F. Harvey,
Assistant Surgeon General, U.S. Army,
Chief Surgeon, Department of the East,
Governor's Island, New York.
Sir:
div1.p:
On November 21, 1906, the Association of Ex-Internes of
Kings County Hospital, Brooklyn, is to dedicate a bronze memorial
tablet to the memory of the late Walter Reed which has been placed
in the main corridor of the Hospital. The representative of the
Association, Dr. A. T. Bristow, 234 Clinton Street, Brooklyn, New
York, has asked the Surgeon General that a member of our Corps
be present at this ceremony, and he has directed me to say that
he would be pleased if you would represent the Medical Department
on this occasion. He also asks that you will communicate with
Dr. Bristow and ascertain the hour of meeting, &c. Dr. Bristow
has been notified today that you will represent the Department
at this meeting.
div1.closer: Very respectfully, [unclear] Major, Surgeon, U.S. Army.
